entries.name: NEWDB
entries.desc:
Indicates that dbm_open() should open the database in read/write mode,
create it if it does not already exist, and delete all contents if it does
already exist.

entries.name: READER
entries.desc: Indicates that dbm_open() should open the database in read-only mode

entries.name: VERSION
entries.desc:
Identifies ndbm library version.
Examples:

“ndbm (4.3BSD)”

“Berkeley DB 4.8.30: (April  9, 2010)”

“Berkeley DB (unknown)” (4.4BSD, maybe)

“GDBM version 1.8.3. 10/15/2002 (built Jul  1 2011 12:32:45)”

“QDBM 1.8.78”

entries.name: WRCREAT
entries.desc:
Indicates that dbm_open() should open the database in read/write mode, and
create it if it does not already exist

entries.name: WRITER
entries.desc: Indicates that dbm_open() should open the database in read/write mode

entries.name: new(filename[, mode[, flags]]) → dbmclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Open a dbm database with the specified name, which can include a directory path. Any file extensions needed will be supplied automatically by the dbm library. For example, Berkeley DB appends '.db', and GNU gdbm uses two physical files with extensions '.dir' and '.pag'.

entries.name: open(filename[, mode[, flags]]) → dbmclick to toggle source
dbm[key] → string value or nilclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Return a value from the database by locating the key string provided.  If the key is not found, returns nil.

entries.name: dbm[key] = valueclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Stores the specified string value in the database, indexed via the string key provided.

entries.name: clearclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Deletes all data from the database.

entries.name: closeclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Closes the database.

entries.name: closed? → true or falseclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the database is closed, false otherwise.

entries.name: delete(key)click to toggle source
entries.desc: Deletes an entry from the database.

entries.name: delete_if {|key, value| block} → selfclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Deletes all entries for which the code block returns true. Returns self.

entries.name: each_pair {|key,value| block} → selfclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Calls the block once for each [key, value] pair in the database. Returns self.

entries.name: each_key {|key| block} → selfclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Calls the block once for each key string in the database. Returns self.

entries.name: each_pair {|key,value| block} → selfclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Calls the block once for each [key, value] pair in the database. Returns self.

entries.name: each_value {|value| block} → selfclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Calls the block once for each value string in the database. Returns self.

entries.name: empty?click to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the database is empty, false otherwise.

entries.name: fetch(key[, ifnone]) → valueclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Return a value from the database by locating the key string provided.  If the key is not found, returns ifnone. If ifnone is not given, raises IndexError.

entries.name: has_key?(key) → booleanclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the database contains the specified key, false otherwise.

entries.name: has_value?(value) → booleanclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the database contains the specified string value, false otherwise.

entries.name: include?(key) → booleanclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the database contains the specified key, false otherwise.

entries.name: invert → hashclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a Hash (not a DBM database) created by using each value in the database as a key, with the corresponding key as its value.

entries.name: key(value) → stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the key for the specified value.

entries.name: key?(key) → booleanclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the database contains the specified key, false otherwise.

entries.name: keys → arrayclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns an array of all the string keys in the database.

entries.name: length → integerclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the number of entries in the database.

entries.name: member?(key) → booleanclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the database contains the specified key, false otherwise.

entries.name: reject {|key,value| block} → Hashclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Converts the contents of the database to an in-memory Hash, then calls Hash#reject with the specified code block, returning a new Hash.

entries.name: reject! {|key, value| block} → selfclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Deletes all entries for which the code block returns true. Returns self.

entries.name: replace(obj)click to toggle source
entries.desc: Replaces the contents of the database with the contents of the specified object. Takes any object which implements the #each_pair method, including Hash and DBM objects.

entries.name: select {|key, value| block} → arrayclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a new array consisting of the [key, value] pairs for which the code block returns true.

entries.name: shift() → [key, value]click to toggle source
entries.desc: Removes a [key, value] pair from the database, and returns it. If the database is empty, returns nil. The order in which values are removed/returned is not guaranteed.

entries.name: size → integerclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the number of entries in the database.

entries.name: store(key, value) → valueclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Stores the specified string value in the database, indexed via the string key provided.

entries.name: to_a → arrayclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Converts the contents of the database to an array of [key, value] arrays, and returns it.

entries.name: to_hash → hashclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Converts the contents of the database to an in-memory Hash object, and returns it.

entries.name: update(obj)click to toggle source
entries.desc: Updates the database with multiple values from the specified object. Takes any object which implements the #each_pair method, including Hash and DBM objects.

entries.name: value?(value) → booleanclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the database contains the specified string value, false otherwise.

entries.name: values → arrayclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns an array of all the string values in the database.

entries.name: values_at(key, ...) → Arrayclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns an array containing the values associated with the given keys.
